intro: Centratherum intermedium, commonly known as the common centatherum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, tubular florets arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Centratherum intermedium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
